textBox.richText: The Gaithersburg Book Festival was a huge success, even considering it had to end an hour early due to a massive thunderstorm that rolled in. The picture above is from the start of the day. As you can see, I’m looking a lot more like a real writer. I’ve got a banner with my own logo and website on it! My husband and I took to heart a few of the things we learned from Charlottesville, and one of the best additions was the “Sci-Fi! Time Travel!” sign. It was probably the biggest draw of people to our table. In fact one woman came up and without waiting for us to say hello, she said “Sci-fi, time travel? Sold!” Easiest sale of the day. The books were flying off the table! I sold of out stock in about 5 hours, keeping one on hand just so people could look at something. I also learned to tailor my pitch depending on the person. A young woman? “Hey, want to read about a woman who works for a secret lab that sends her back in time to solve mysteries?!” Sean made sure I played up the fact that my protagonist is a woman. It was a much better experience than Charlottesville. Part of that seemed to be the crowd-I guess the DC area has more sci-fi readers. It definitely helps to have a second person around. There were a few times that I got into lengthy conversations with one person, but Sean was able to continue selling the book as I was engaged. Sadly it seems like the season of book festival that I can participate in has ended. I’ll have to start looking earlier next year.
